hints.content:
The juice container is filled to $\goldE{{60} \text { mL}}$.  

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A graduated cylinder labeled with tick marks from 10 milliliters to 100 milliliters. Tick marks 10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70, 80, 90, and 100 milliliters are labeled. 1 unlabeled tick mark is shown before 10 milliliters and 1 unlabeled tick mark is between every 2 labeled tick marks. The juice inside the graduated cylinder measures to the tick mark 60 milliliters. A line extends from the tick mark at 60 milliliters and is labeled 60 milliliters. !

hints.content:
We can find the number of friends by dividing the total amount of juice in the container $(\goldE{{60} \text { mL}})$ by the number of milliliters he gives each friend $(\blueD{5 \text { mL}})$.


[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: Two rectangles sit on top of each other. The longer top rectangle is labeled 60. The shorter bottom rectangle is labeled 5. A curved bracket at the bottom of both rectangles is labeled question mark equal groups. !

question.content:
Monty Mouse has some friends over.  He shares all of his juice (shown below) with his friends. He gives each friend $5$ milliliters of juice.

 

[[☃ image 1]]

  **How many friends does Monty have over?**  
*Monty does not drink any juice himself.*


[[☃ input-number 1]] friends

options.alt: A graduated cylinder labeled with tick marks from 10 milliliters to 100 milliliters. Tick marks 10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70, 80, 90, and 100 milliliters are labeled. 1 unlabeled tick mark is shown before 10 milliliters and 1 unlabeled tick mark is between every 2 labeled tick marks. The juice inside the graduated cylinder measures to the tick mark 60 milliliters. !
